oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tennessee State Historical Marker 3A 29, Belle Meade, Nashville, Tennessee, n.d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A Tennessee Historical Commission marker commemorating the historic Belle Meade mansion, located in Davidson County, Tennessee. The plaque reads: Established by John Harding, 1806, on site of Dunham’s Station, Cumberland Settlements. This house was built after the first mansion burned in 1853. William Giles Harding founded here the first Thoroughbred nursery in the United States; his son-in-law, Gen. William H. Jackson, improved it. It closed at the death of his son, William Harding Jackson.” Forms part of the Bill Goodman Photographic Slides Collection. 1 35 mm negative.
